result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Spoke with DEF again re: Warrant.  DE actually made payment of $60 to the WI Public Defender's office and not the Clerk of Court office.  The PD's office will not refund the $60.  Since there is so much confusion, DE is approved to make a $50 payment by 9-1-22, and will be reinstated on her PP. cah

Spoke with DE re: Warrant and PP.  DEF approved to make $60 payment today and warrant will be quashed and PP reset as a one-time courtesy.  DE was informed that in the future if she needs an extension, she has to call or write the Court a letter, and that if she misses another payment she will be sent to collections and additional fees will be added by SDC. cah

for bond modification. Filed by DE. arc
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

* AMENDED *

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Syrgeo P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 
If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

-   Contact with minor children C.R.T. & J.C.T. only as permitted in 22JC17 and 22JC18.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:46 AM  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, ADA:  Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman, DF:  Jessica Lynn Howlett appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. Atty. Chapman states that discovery has not yet been received. Court sets PSC. Court reviews letter from DE regarding bond modification request. Court modifies bond to be consistent with pending matters regarding children. Adjourned. kma  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arraignment on March 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

* AMENDED *

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Syrgeo P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 
If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.R.T. & J.C.T.   The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF108 & 22CF107 
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman and  DF:  Jessica Lynn Howlett appeared in 22CF108. DE ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson and DF: Syrgeo Romeo Perez appeared in 22CF107. Case called at 2:05 p.m. Court notes both matters are scheduled for preliminary hearing. Court notes receiving a letter filed from Mr. Perez on 22CF107 requesting new counsel. Atty Harrelson has spoke to client in regards to the request and DE has withdrawn request. DE Mr. Perez confirms.  ADA Rockow calls Det. Ryan Bleskey to the Stand. S/T Ryan Bleskey. Employed with the City of Hudson Police Department. Direct by ADA Rockow. Witness identifies both DE's in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Rockow. No further evidence by either party. No argument by Atty Chapman. Atty Harrelson gives argument. Argues probable cause.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial in both 22CF107 & 22CF108. Atty Chapman is prepared to continue arraignment today. ADA Rockow requesting matters be scheduled out. Court schedules. Atty Chapman is requesting bond be modified to no abusive contact. ADA Rockow objects. Court will amend bond.  Arraignment scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Order for payment on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Chapman. e: DA. arc
